param.name: themelet
param.label: Select themelet
param.description: Select which themelet you would like to use. The themelets are stored in your templates assets folder. Use the Installer tab on the right to install new themelets.

param.name: site_width
param.label: Site width
param.description: Set your sites page width. The full width 100% option is a bit buggy at the moment - especially with the fixed 200px left and right sidebar layout defaults (ie, your inner and outer layouts).

param.name: custom_body_sfx
param.label: Custom Body Suffix
param.description: Set a suffix to appear on the body as a class to use for additional styling with css

param.name: global_wrap
param.label: Enable global wrap
param.description: This option if enabled, will wrap the main structural blocks with a global wrapper

param.name: global_wrap_start
param.label: Wrap start position
param.description: Set the position of the global wrap start position (ie, the opening div)

param.name: global_wrap_end
param.label: Wrap end position
param.description: Set the position of the global wrap end position (ie, the closing div)

param.name: remove_generator
param.label: Remove Joomla! meta tag
param.description: The Joomla! meta generator is tag that is outputted in your sites xhtml, which will tell anyone who looks at the code that you are using Joomla!. This in most cases is fine, except when it comes to security. Its recommended that you leave this turned off.

param.name: ie6_upgrade
param.label: Enable ie6 upgrade notice
param.description: This option will display an upgrade notice to anyone visiting your site in Internet Explorer 6.

param.name: plugin_scrollto
param.label: Display scroll to top link
param.description: This plugin will show a scroll-to-top link when you scroll to the bottom of your page.

param.name: chrome_frame
param.label: Enable Google Chrome Frame
param.description: This will include the Google Chrome Frame meta tag in the Morph template. If the plugin is not installed on the users browser it will prompt the user to install the plugin on their browser. This is only for Internet Explorer versions 6-8.

param.name: modernizr
param.label: Enable Modernizr
param.description: Modernizr is a javascript script that adds a number of classes to your sites html element, based on the browsers css3 support, allowing you to take advantage of css3 in your site, without compromising the experience for users on older browsers. Learn more at modernizr.com

param.name: selectivizr
param.label: Enable Selectivizr
param.description: Selectivizr is a JavaScript utility that emulates CSS3 pseudo-classes and attribute selectors in Internet Explorer 6-8. Simply include the script in your pages and selectivizr will do the rest.. Learn more at http://selectivizr.com/

param.name: google_analytics
param.label: Google Analytics ID
param.description: Entering your Google Analytics ID will automatically load the needed tracking javascript, just above the closing body tag of your site. We plan on extending this to use any tracking or related javascript in the future, but for now this will have to do :)

param.name: logo_type
param.label: Logo type
param.description: How would you like your logo to be outputed? A full tutorial explaining each of the options listed here will be added soon.

param.name: logo_image
param.label: Logo image
param.description: If you haven't already, upload your logo using the Installer tool on the right, then once you have done that, select the logo from the list.

param.name: logo_autodimensions
param.label: Logo dimensions
param.description: Select whether you would like Configurator to automatically determine your chosen image's dimensions. Using this with the 'Linked inline image' logo option will actually change the dimensions of the logo image, where as with the Linked h1 image replacement, it will just change the width and height of the linked h1 element.

param.name: logo_width
param.label: Logo width
param.description: Set your logo width

param.name: logo_height
param.label: Logo height
param.description: Set your logo height

param.name: logo_ielogo
param.label: Display ie6 logo
param.description: Would you like to alternate logo displayed to Internet Explorer 6? This option is useful when you want to use a transparent png image for all standards compliant browsers and a less smooth transparent logo for ie6, which doesnt handle image transparency.

param.name: logo_ielogo_image
param.label: IE6 logo image
param.description: We have added the option to have an alternate logo to display in IE6. This is useful if you are using a transparent png for your logo and would like to have a gif displayed for people browsing your site in Internet Explorer 6.

param.name: logo_text
param.label: Logo text
param.description: Set your logo text

param.name: logo0_fontfamily
param.label: Logo font
param.description: Choose which font family you would like to use.

param.name: logo0_textsize
param.label: Text size
param.description: Adjust the font size of your custom logo text.

param.name: logo0_textcolor
param.label: Text color
param.description: Set your logo text foreground color.

param.name: logo0_linktitle
param.label: Link title text
param.description: Set your logo link title text

param.name: logo0_top
param.label: Top position
param.description: Set your logos x-coordinate (ie, the number of pixels it should be positioned from the top. You can set the amount as either pixels, em's or a percentage. For example 10px, 10em or 10%. Please note that no spaces should be used.

param.name: logo0_left
param.label: Left position
param.description: Set your logos y-coordinate (ie, the number of pixels it should be positioned from the left. You can set the amount as either pixels, em's or a percentage. For example 10px, 10em or 10%. Please note that no spaces should be used.

param.name: logo0_stack
param.label: Stacking order
param.description: Set the stacking order (z-index) of your sites logo.

param.name: logo1_linktitle
param.label: Link title text
param.description: Set your logo link title text

param.name: logo1_top
param.label: Top position
param.description: Set your logos x-coordinate (ie, the number of pixels it should be positioned from the top. You can set the amount as either pixels, em's or a percentage. For example 10px, 10em or 10%. Please note that no spaces should be used.

param.name: logo1_left
param.label: Left position
param.description: Set your logos y-coordinate (ie, the number of pixels it should be positioned from the left. You can set the amount as either pixels, em's or a percentage. For example 10px, 10em or 10%. Please note that no spaces should be used.

param.name: logo1_stack
param.label: Stacking order
param.description: Set the stacking order (z-index) of your sites logo.

param.name: logo2_alttext
param.label: Logo text
param.description: Set your logo text

param.name: logo2_linktitle
param.label: Link title text
param.description: Set your logo link title text

param.name: logo2_top
param.label: Top position
param.description: Set your logos x-coordinate (ie, the number of pixels it should be positioned from the top. You can set the amount as either pixels, em's or a percentage. For example 10px, 10em or 10%. Please note that no spaces should be used.

param.name: logo2_left
param.label: Left position
param.description: Set your logos y-coordinate (ie, the number of pixels it should be positioned from the left. You can set the amount as either pixels, em's or a percentage. For example 10px, 10em or 10%. Please note that no spaces should be used.

param.name: logo2_stack
param.label: Stacking order
param.description: Set the stacking order (z-index) of your sites logo.

param.name: logo_block
param.label: Which block to show logo in?
param.description: In which of Morphs blocks listed here would you like to display your logo in

param.name: logowrap_height
param.label: Logo containers height
param.description: Set the height of the logos wrapping container.

param.name: display_slogan
param.label: Display tagline
param.description: Would you like to display a slogan.

param.name: slogan_text
param.label: Tagline text
param.description: Set the text to use for your sites slogan. This box will automatically expand as needed.

param.name: slogan_textcolor
param.label: Text color
param.description: Set your slogans text foreground color.

param.name: slogan_fontsize
param.label: Text size
param.description: Adjust the font size of your custom slogan text.

param.name: slogan_fontfamily
param.label: Font family
param.description: Choose which font family you would like to use.

param.name: slogan_top
param.label: Top position
param.description: Set your slogan's x-coordinate (ie, the number of pixels it should be positioned from the top. You can set the amount as either pixels, em's or a percentage. For example 10px, 10em or 10%. Please note that no spaces should be used.

param.name: slogan_left
param.label: Left position
param.description: Set your slogan's y-coordinate (ie, the number of pixels it should be positioned from the left. You can set the amount as either pixels, em's or a percentage. For example 10px, 10em or 10%. Please note that no spaces should be used.

param.name: slogan_stack
param.label: Stacking order
param.description: Set the stacking order (z-index) of your sites tagline.

param.name: html_bg_color
param.label: Background color
param.description: Setting a color here will adjust your sites background color.

param.name: use_html_bg_image
param.label: Use background image
param.description: Would you like to use a background image?

param.name: html_bg_image
param.label: Background image
param.description: Choose a background to use for your site. The backgrounds are located in your assets / backgrounds folder. You can upload new backgrounds using the Universal Installer tool in the Toolbox tab.

param.name: html_bg_repeat
param.label: Background repeat
param.description: If a background image is set, how should it repeat?

param.name: html_bg_position
param.label: Background position
param.description: Set the backgrounds position

param.name: html_bg_attachment
param.label: Background attachment
param.description: Should be the background be fixed or should it scroll

param.name: body_bg_color
param.label: Background color
param.description: Setting a color here will adjust your sites background color.

param.name: use_body_bg_image
param.label: Use background image
param.description: Would you like to use a background image?

param.name: body_bg_image
param.label: Background image
param.description: Choose a background to use for your site. The backgrounds are located in your assets / backgrounds folder. You can upload new backgrounds using the Universal Installer tool in the Toolbox tab.

param.name: body_bg_repeat
param.label: Background repeat
param.description: If a background image is set, how should it repeat?

param.name: body_bg_position
param.label: Background position
param.description: Set the backgrounds position

param.name: body_bg_attachment
param.label: Background attachment
param.description: Should be the background be fixed or should it scroll

param.name: color_h1
param.label: Heading 1 color
param.description: Set the foreground color of your H1 headings.

param.name: color_h2
param.label: Heading 2 color
param.description: Set the foreground color of your H2 headings.

param.name: color_h3
param.label: Heading 3 color
param.description: Set the foreground color of your H3 headings.

param.name: color_h4
param.label: Heading 4 color
param.description: Set the foreground color of your H4 headings.

param.name: color_h5
param.label: Heading 5 color
param.description: Set the foreground color of your H5 headings.

param.name: color_links
param.label: Links color
param.description: Set the foreground color of your links text.

param.name: color_linkshover
param.label: Links hover color
param.description: Set the hover color of your links text.

param.name: color_linksvisited
param.label: Links visited color
param.description: Set the visited color of your links text.

param.name: color_bodytext
param.label: Body text color
param.description: Set the foreground color of your sites main body text.

param.name: gfont_text_enabled
param.label: Logo only
param.description: By selecting the logo only option, the font you select will be customized via Googles servers to only include support for the characters used in your logo, meaning a smaller font file.

param.name: gfont_selectors
param.label: Add selectors to target here
param.description: Add a string of selectors seperated by a comma that you would like to apply the font to.

param.name: topnav_hoverintent
param.label: HoverIntent
param.description: HoverIntent is a plug-in that attempts to determine the user's intent... like a crystal ball, only with mouse movement! This generally improves the usability of your Superfish menu.

param.name: topnav_hoverfocus
param.label: HoverFocus
param.description: HoverFocus is an experimental feature which fades out contents of the topshelf when you hover on to child items of the top navigation. This allows you to focus on the menu items rather than the underlying content. This feature is still a bit buggy.

param.name: topnav_hoverfocus_block
param.label: HoverFocus block
param.description: Which block is active below the menu? Please note that the blocks 'Block Inner' option needs to be enabled for the block you choose.

param.name: topnav_actionlink
param.label: Call for action link
param.description: A call for action link can be described as the primary action that you would like your visitors to take. This could be a newsletter signup link, registration link, or even a buy now link. All this option is doing is enabling a snippet of extra css that targets the last menu item to give it alternate styling.

param.name: topnav_supersubs
param.label: Auto width on sub items
param.description: Would you like the sub menu items width to adjust automatically?

param.name: topnav_minwidth
param.label: Child items min width
param.description: Set the minimum width of child menu items.

param.name: topnav_maxwidth
param.label: Child items max width
param.description: Set the maximum width of child menu items.

param.name: topnav_delay
param.label: Menu delay
param.description: How many seconds would you like the menu's animation to delay? IE, how long should the menu drop down stay after the user mouses off of it.

param.name: topnav_animation
param.label: Animation speed
param.description: This option sets the speed in which the top navigation animates.

param.name: topnav_position
param.label: Topnav position
param.description: Where would you like the top menu to be displayed.

param.name: topnav_show
param.label: Disable block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?

param.name: iphone_mode
param.label: iPhone compatibility
param.description: Would you like your site to automatically be iPhone compatible?

param.name: iphone_header
param.label: iPhone header
param.description: Select a 320px x 50px header image to use on your iPhone optimized site. Images uploaded to your morph_assets/iphone directory will automatically appear in this list.

param.name: iphone_webclip
param.label: iPhone webclip
param.description: Select a 57px by 57px image to use for your webclip bookmark. Images uploaded to your morph_assets/iphone directory will automatically appear in this list. This option a work in progress and will hopefully be 100% working in the next release.

param.name: iphone_viewport
param.label: iPhone viewport
param.description: Would you like to manually select custom viewport settings? Not all setting require to be set as the iPhose OS will infer these based on what is set.

param.name: iphone_scalable
param.label: iPhone user scalable
param.description: Would you like to allow users to scale the webpage? Set to Off for best results with iPhone webapps.

param.name: iphone_width
param.label: iPhone width
param.description: Set a custom width for the viewport (e.g. 974). Type device-width for best results with iPhone webapps.

param.name: iphone_height
param.label: iPhone height
param.description: Set a custom width for the viewport. Generally this setting can be left blank.

param.name: iphone_scale
param.label: iPhone scale
param.description: Set a custom scale for the viewport. Generally this setting can be left blank.

param.name: js_enable_toolbar
param.label: Enable the JomSocial menu
param.description: Would you like the JomSocial toolbar menu to be displayed?

param.name: js_enable_header
param.label: Enable the login/register block
param.description: Would you like the JomSocial welcome header to be displayed?

param.name: js_enable_sidebar
param.label: Enable the JomSocial sidebar
param.description: Would you like the JomSocial sidebar to be displayed?

param.name: shareit_enabled
param.label: Enable article sharing
param.description: Would you like the Share it box enabled on the article page?

param.name: shorturl_enabled
param.label: Enable short url
param.description: Would you like a tiny url of your article added to your articles meta information?

param.name: fontsizer_enabled
param.label: Enable font sizer
param.description: Would you like the font sizer enabled on the article page?

param.name: teaser_enabled
param.label: Enable teaser styling
param.description: Would you like first paragraph of your articles to have the emphasized teaser styling?

param.name: lazyload_enabled
param.label: Lazy load images
param.description: Would you like to enable the lazyload image loading plugin?

param.name: article_title
param.label: Display the article title
param.description: Would you like to disable the article title on the details page? This is generally only ever used along side the SimpleTitle module.

param.name: article_preview
param.label: Show preview link
param.description: Would you like to enable the article preview link in the blog and frontpage views?

param.name: pack_css
param.label: Enable css packing
param.description: CSS Packing (otherwise refered to as CSS Concatination) refers to the combining of multiple files into a single file. This boosts your sites performance as fewer http requests are needed.

param.name: minify_css
param.label: Minify css
param.description: Minifying will remove empty spaces and line returns that'll make the CSS less readable, but faster loading. This process is often done manually when a site is completed and the code no longer neads to be readable. The minify process is very intense, so if a lot of css it'll make your site load slower than if disabled.

param.name: data_uris
param.label: dataURIs (experimental)
param.description: Encoding css images to dataURI dramatically improve pageload performance in a number of ways. It reduces the image size. And it reduces the amount of HTTP Requests done to the page. In order to further optimize this we've got a separate cache in Morph that makes sure that the image encoding process is only run once per image. If you make changes to an image, just clear your Joomla cache to refresh the image.

param.name: pack_js
param.label: Enable js packing
param.description: JS Packing (otherwise refered to as JS Concatination) refers to the combining of multiple files into a single file. This boosts your sites performance as fewer http requests are needed.

param.name: minify_js
param.label: Minify js
param.description: Minifying will remove empty spaces and line returns that'll make the JS less readable, but demand lesser bandwidth. This process can be very intense if you got a lot of JS, so for larger sites it'll load faster if minification is off.

param.name: cache
param.label: Enable caching
param.description: Caching the dynamic css and js files will greatly improve performance regarding response time (the 'waiting for response' delay) and loadtimes. Turn on gzip too for the best possible performance.

param.name: cachetime
param.label: Cache Expire Time
param.description: Configurator will always purge the cache whenever you make an change in Morph's settings. But if you make changes affecting what css and/or js Morph loads outside of the configurator, like if you unpublish the simpletweet module, cache expire time will ensure that the cache refresh to reflect those changes. There's a balance on how quick you want the cache to refresh, and how snappy you want your site to load. We've found 15 minutes to have the most 'Zen' balance to it.

param.name: gzip_compression
param.label: Enable gzip
param.description: Gzip is a form of optimization that causes pages to be compressed before being transmitted from server to browser, making the transmitted data smaller, thus speeding up the delivery.

param.name: load_mootools
param.label: Enable mootools
param.description: Mootools is a javascript framework that is used mostly in the backend of Joomla! There are a few instances in the frontend where it is needed (which we have taken into account), but in most cases this is not needed and in order to get optimal performance we have completely removed it from the frontend. This saves around 75kb from your sites total weight.

param.name: nojs
param.label: Zero javascript mode
param.description: This option will disable all javascript from the loading on the frontend of Morph. There is only one small generic snippet of javascript that is loaded if you view your site in Internet Explorer 6, which is needed to add support for hover on non anchor (link) elements. This option is good for debugging javascript conflicts. Rule of thumb, if the javascript error persists with Morph's javascript disabled, then the problem is not related to Morph.

param.name: code_comments
param.label: Enable code comments
param.description: Morph's code comments are currently in their infancy, but will be extensively improved before the stable release. The idea behind them is to make it super easy to find exactly where a section of code is being loaded from. Each comment will wrap around the specific section of code, include the filename in which it resides as well as the line number.

param.name: error_reporting
param.label: Enable error reporting
param.description: This will enable all php errors and notices to be displayed.

param.name: jquery_core
param.label: Enable jQuery
param.description: Morph uses jQuery extensively, so this should generally be left enabled. We have added the option to disable more for testing / debugging purposes.

param.name: jquery_blacklist
param.label: Prevent css/js from loading
param.description: This option can be used to remove any css or js files from loading on the frontend of your. For example, if you are using an extension that loads its own instance of jQuery, you can list path to the file (as outputted in your sites fronend html) here and Morph will remove it from the frontend html output. This will help avoid javascript errors due to multiple jQuery instances on the same page. List is separated with commas.

param.name: debug_modules
param.label: Enable module outlines
param.description: Enabling this option will globally override all module chromes to use the outline chrome option. This is good when you want to see which module positions are being used where.

param.name: debug
param.label: Enable debug mode
param.description: Debug mode lets you control morph by the url.

param.name: remove_outline
param.label: Disable ?tp=1
param.description: This option will disable the ability to view your sites module positions using ?tp=1 appended to the url of your site.

param.name: developer_toolbar
param.label: Show Developer Toolbar
param.description: Enabling this option will show a developer toolbar on your website with a list of tools that can be used to help debug your template.

param.name: captions_enabled
param.label: Enable fancy captions
param.description: Would you like to enable the fancy captions plugin?

param.name: captions_animation
param.label: Caption animation
param.description: Choose whether to animate the caption or have it always displayed.

param.name: captions_speedover
param.label: Mouseover speed
param.description: Set the speed of the mouseover effect

param.name: captions_speedout
param.label: Mouseout speed
param.description: Set the speed of the mouseout effect

param.name: captions_delay
param.label: Mouseout delay
param.description: How long to delay the hiding of the caption after mouseout (in milliseconds)

param.name: captions_opacity
param.label: Caption opacity
param.description: Set the opacity of the caption

param.name: captions_position
param.label: Caption position
param.description: Set the captions position to top or bottom.

param.name: captions_prefix
param.label: Caption prefix
param.description: You can optionally set a prefix to use on your captions.

param.name: captions_bgcolor
param.label: Caption background color
param.description: Set the captions background color.

param.name: captions_textcolor
param.label: Caption text color
param.description: Set the captions background color.

param.name: captions_bordercolor
param.label: Caption border color
param.description: Set the captions border color.

param.name: captions_borderheight
param.label: Captions border height
param.description: Set the height of the caption border.

param.name: lightbox_enabled
param.label: Enable Lightbox
param.description: Would you like to enable the Colorbox Lightbox plugin?

param.name: disable_scrollbar
param.label: Disable browser scrollbar
param.description: Would you like the browser scrollbar disabled when colorbox is open?

param.name: colorbox_style
param.label: Colorbox style
param.description: Would you like to enable the article preview link in the blog and frontpage views?

param.name: preloader_enabled
param.label: Enable the preloader
param.description: Would you like to enable the preloader plugin?

param.name: preloader_background
param.label: Preloader background color
param.description: Set the color of the preloader background.

param.name: preloader_foreground
param.label: Preloader foreground color
param.description: Set the color of the preloader foreground.

param.name: preloader_height
param.label: Loading bar height
param.description: Set the height of the loading bar.

param.name: megamenu_enabled
param.label: Enable the megamenu
param.description: Would you like to enable the megamenu plugin?

param.name: toolbar_position
param.label: Toolbar position
param.description: Where would you like the toolbar to be displayed.

param.name: toolbar_slider_text
param.label: Slider text
param.description: Define the toggle button text. You can either display a single word like toggle, or set different text for each state, for example 'open,close'. Its important that there are no spaces between the two words and that you use a comma to seperate them.

param.name: toolbar_show
param.label: Disable block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?

param.name: display_skipto
param.label: Display skip to menu
param.description: Would you like to display a skip to content menu?

param.name: masthead_show
param.label: Disable block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?

param.name: subhead_show
param.label: Disable block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?

param.name: topshelf1_show
param.label: Disable block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?

param.name: topshelf2_show
param.label: Disable block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?

param.name: topshelf3_show
param.label: Disable block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?

param.name: bottomshelf1_show
param.label: Disable block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?

param.name: bottomshelf2_show
param.label: Disable block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?

param.name: bottomshelf3_show
param.label: Disable block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?

param.name: user1_show
param.label: Disable block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?

param.name: user2_show
param.label: Disable block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?

param.name: padding_bdinner
param.label: Padding for main content wrap
param.description: This will add padding to the left and right of the div that wraps around both sidebars (inner and outer) and main content

param.name: sidebars_gutter
param.label: Gap between sidebars & content
param.description: This will add padding equal to this value between sidebars

param.name: pathway_text_show
param.label: Enable pathway pre-text
param.description: This option lets you choose whether or not to display the text before the pathway module, eg: You are here

param.name: pathway_text
param.label: Pathway pre-text
param.description: Would you like the pathway text to be displayed? This will not impact the actual pathway module itself.

param.name: secondary_inner
param.label: Inner wrapping
param.description: Would you like the secondary content sidebar to have an inner wrap div? This is useful if you need to add padding to the contents of the sidebar.

param.name: inner_show
param.label: Show inner sidebar
param.description: Would you like the s?

param.name: inner_pos
param.label: Inner sidebar position
param.description: Position the sidebar to the left or right of the main content?

param.name: inner_width
param.label: Width of inner sidebar
param.description: Set a width in % or px for the inner sidebar

param.name: tertiary_inner
param.label: Inner wrapping
param.description: Would you like the secondary content sidebar to have an inner wrap div? This is useful if you need to add padding to the contents of the sidebar.

param.name: footer_copyright_show
param.label: Display copyright
param.description: Would you like the footer copyright to be display?

param.name: footer_copyright
param.label: Copyright text
param.description: Add your own copyright here

param.name: footer_credits_show
param.label: Display credits
param.description: Would you like the footer credits to be display?

param.name: footer_credits
param.default: Template Designed by JoomlaJunkie
param.label: Credits text
param.description: Add your own credits here

param.name: footer_morphlink
param.label: Show Powered by Morph
param.description: We've made it optional to disable the Morph Inside link, but please consider leaving it on.

param.name: footer_validation
param.label: Show validation links
param.description: Should the xhtml validation link be displayed in the footer?

param.name: footer_show
param.label: Disable the footer block
param.description: Would you like to disable this block?
